results.title: From the bush
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “From spirit to spirit (A)”.
Explores how Aboriginal rock and roll singers combine black and white aspects of their life to create music. Living in a desert, they team up with a “whitefella” band and they commence a tour with a difference.
results.description:
Episode number 5 of Series “From spirit to spirit (A)”.

results.title: Rockets and reindeer
results.creator_credit: Bo-Erik Gyberg, Levande Bilder and Min Govat Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “From spirit to spirit (A)”.
The ancient way of life of the Sami reindeer herders is being challenged by the 20th Century. This program examines the impact of modern technology on the indigenous Sami in far north Sweden with the advent of space stations, computerised administration, motorised herding methods and the impact of tourism.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bo-Erik Gyberg, Levande Bilder and Min Govat Productions

results.title: Renaissance
results.creator_credit: Patricia Phillips, Andy Thomson, Brenda Hennig and Great North Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “From spirit to spirit (A)”.
Documents the revival of the native ceremonial dramas of the Canadian Indians, illegal since the 19th Century. Since then, the traditional performances have improved into theatrical mainstream and international community theatre.

results.title: Gathering threads = Tui Tuia
results.creator_credit: Christina Ngahuia Asher, Carol J Paewai, Nga Kara Whetu and TopShelf Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “From spirit to spirit (A)”.
The art of weaving is an important cultural, social and economic activity among the Maori and Pacific Islander peoples. Aotearoa Moananui and Kiwa weavers are determined to continue the craft. Modern technology has allowed them to cultivate, protect and develop their art as part of their heritage.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Christina Ngahuia Asher, Carol J Paewai, Nga Kara Whetu and TopShelf Productions

results.title: Zoo tails
results.creator_credit: Gill Lomas, Tosca Looby and ABC-TV (Australia). Natural History Unit
results.brief_description: 20 short zoo stories are contained on this tape narrated by an 11 year old boy. Discover tapirs, owl chicks, big cats, hippos, seals, a baby puma, plus many more animals. Filmed at the Melbourne Zoo by ABC’s award winning Natural History Unit.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gill Lomas, Tosca Looby and ABC-TV (Australia). Natural History Unit

results.title: Quest for country
results.creator_credit: Michael Riley, Rachel Perkins and Blackfella Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “From spirit to spirit (A)”.
This program expresses the spiritual and physical catharsis of an Aboriginal man from the urban environment. Michael Riley gives an insight into the indigenous view of white society and highlights the problems which non-Aboriginal people may have in understanding this attitude as well as the difficulties Aboriginal people may have in explaining it.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Riley, Rachel Perkins and Blackfella Films

results.title: Zoo Robbery (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Six kids find themselves in a real life game of cops and robbers when the London Zoo’s star attraction, Yen-Yen the Yeti mysteriously disappears. An action drama to satisfy every kid’s dream. Rated: G
results.description: Six kids find themselves in a real life game of cops and robbers when the London Zoo’s star attraction, Yen-Yen the Yeti mysteriously disappears. An action drama to satisfy every kid’s dream. Rated: G

results.title: Zoo Olympics
results.creator_credit: Picha, Eric Van Beuren, Francis Nielsen, Rooster Studio and Y C Alligatorfilm
results.brief_description: Drawn by French animator Picha, here are 26 episodes of the hilarious animal Olympics antics. These are parodies of Olympic events, based vaguely on behaviours in the animal kingdom, such as egg laying and rolling (chickens), slop slurping (pigs) and kangaroo boxing.

results.title: The Trumpet of the swan
results.creator_credit: Richard Rich, Terry L Noss, Lin Oliver and Tiny Tot Productions
results.brief_description: Louie, a Trumpeter swan born without a voice, falls in love but has no way of communicating his emotions. Feeling despondent and at odds with his siblings with wonderful calls, he leaves home on a journey where he meets a young boy called Sam and his teacher, Mrs Hammerbotham, who teaches Louie how to speak. Learning English is not the solution to Louie’s problem however as none of the other swans can understand him. A solution is reached when Louie’s father gives his son a trumpet which he begins to play proficiently. Unbeknownst to Louie though, his father has stolen the trumpet in a moment of desperation to help his son. A stint in a jazz band and a race to reclaim his now engaged childhood love, Serena, ensues in this animated adaption of E.B. White’s classic children’s tale. Features the voices of Dee Baker, Jason Alexander, Reese Witherspoon, Seth Green, Carol Burnett, Mary Steenburgen and Joe Mantegna.
